question.title: Configuring SSL for Spring is ignoring file specified by server.ssl.key-store parameter and instead loading cert from homedirectory/.keystore
question.body:
Running Java 17 and Spring Boot 3.4.3 I have SSL configured in application.properties:

server.port=9969
server.ssl.enabled=true
server.ssl.key-store=file:/absolutepath/keystore.p12
server.ssl.key-store-password=pwd123
server.ssl.key-password=pwd123
server.ssl.key-store-type=PKCS12
server.ssl.key-alias=myalias

However, the only way to get SSL configured is if I copy my keystore to the file name ".keystore" in my home directory. Once I do that I was able to successfully connect a client to my server through SSL. I have tried using the prefix "classpath:" and also no prefix with an absolute path and in all cases the startup output says:


2025-09-22T14:57:51.854-04:00  INFO 1384329 --- [           main] o.a.t.util.net.NioEndpoint.certificate
   : Connector [https-jsse-nio-9969], TLS virtual host [_default_], certificate type
   [UNDEFINED] configured from keystore [/home/myuserid/.keystore] using alias [myalias] 
   with trust store [null]

If I omit the "key-store" parameter I get this exception so it appears that it is accessing the configured key-store: Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: SSL is enabled but no trust material is configured for the default host

Any ideas what is wrong with my configuration for the key-store parameter in being ignored, (somewhat)?

answers.body:
I am sure it worked for me when I used relative path like

server.ssl.key-store="classpath:server.p12"

In this case need to add *.p12 file to the classpath
